course_description: The structure and organization of computer operating systems. Process, memory, and I/O management; device drivers, inter-machine communication, introduction to multiprocessor systems. An important portion of the course is a course long programming project that implements a simple operating system in stages. Each stage takes about three weeks, and is used as a basis for the next stage.
sections: Class Nbr: 1896, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: K. Mandelberg, Status: Open
